result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrice Delina Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrice Delina Scott in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Patrice Delina Scott.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case rescheduled off the record due to court congestion. Defendant also tested positive for COVID-19.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrice Delina Scott in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding counsel. Defendant requested attorney Angel Johnson to appear at next court date.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrice Delina Scott in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrice Delina Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Pretrial Conference. Defendant is eligible for public defender appointment but requests to represent herself for the remainder of the case. Attorney Flynn moves to withdraw. Court grants. Defendant advised of her right to counsel.  
Court examined defendant as to her request to represent herself and waiver of counsel.
Further discussion held with defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives her right to counsel. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no violent contact with R.A.H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no violent contact with the victim.

Defendant Patrice Delina Scott in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Patrice Delina Scott in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrice Delina Scott
Current: 2429 N. 39th St. Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 04-30-2022)
Prior: 2960 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
